ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Newbie bard leaves Kunark (was Newbie bard race to  12 )
ygData.msgSnippet: Lake of Ill Omens contains plentiful mobs in all levels from level 3-4 thru 27-29.  You just have to hunt in different regions. I think that mobs for your
ygData.messageBody:
Lake of Ill Omens contains plentiful mobs in all levels from level 3-4 thru
27-29. You just have to hunt in different regions.

I think that mobs for your level would be just to the right of where the
river hits the lake. If you continue back in that direction you will be in
the Iksar newbie zone and have to keep your eyes open for the Iksar guards.

Tomerrilin

-----Original Message-----
From: Elijah Meeker [mailto:emeeker@...]
Sent: Wednesday, July 12, 2000 10:36 AM
To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Newbie bard leaves Kunark (was Newbie bard race
to 12 )



> Have you tried the Lake of Ill Omen yet?

I peeked in there last night, everything was red and yellow, I decided it
would be best to go back after a few levels.

As I ran, with one mob behind me and one still fighting
> my husband (who was doing fine with the one) I remembered some
> discussions about crowd control and running circles with mobs in
> tow. So I made sure I had my mandolin equipped and made a wide turn
> back while healing myself. Once the battle was done I deposited the
> extra mob back where we were originally fighting and we finished him
> off. So much better getting exp on the 2 mobs than zoning.

"Heal Kiting" rocks :o) I used it all the time on the south shore of Eask
karana against Gnoll Reavers. Without SoW it goes like this:

Selos, autorun
Arm drum to get distance
switch to lute
alternate selos and hymn

keep them close enough to keep chasing you, I *think* their healing rate is
the combat one when chasing not the faster non-combat rate.

Tsengu
